message: I know that the final stable version of jQuery is 1.5 but as i see, a lot of people still use 1.3+. I know that some plugins or components don't work with latest versions, but the core of jQuery from 1.4 was rewrited and it's faster, better, ... you know.
Mostly using 1.4, works with all the plugins I need. I plan on switching to 1.5 for upcoming projects.
yeah me too
im currently using 1.4 - sometimes i just leave the jQuery untouched in my app so nothing breaks. I will be upgrading to 1.5 for my most recent app once out of the testing phase.
Always latest
http://code.jquery.com/jquery-git.js I RIDE THE TIP OF THE WAVE
Currently using a patched 1.4.3, upgrading to 1.5 as soon as the next release is out of QC ;D
@manakmichal yes, from 1.4 the core had a rewrite and got faster.. the most notable - in my opinion - was the .live() event :)
Current projects are using 1.4.3. Future projects are going to use 1.5 - maybe downgrading to 1.4 if plugins will stop to work. But until now, it looks fine.
Latest, what else ?
@MarcosBL a lot of people still use older version of jQuery
I didn't even realize they'd updated it to 1.5 until I read it here.  Yay Convore!   Lol.
We use 1.4.2, will have to update :)
I use 1.5. Why? Because I am the only one in my work working with jQuery, and i'm already testing and learning how to use it!
The latest
Well i'll change my answer, i'm using 1.4.4, cause jQuery 1.5 messing with older IE versions. If i'm not wrong it requires IE9 as top level version on explorer.
Onwards to 1.5.1!
Our corporate standard is 1.4.2
I have the advantage of being the only person who looks at my code so I just use jquery-latest.

When I start a project I always use the latest version. My rule of thumb is, that if a jQuery plugin doesn't work with the latest version of jQuery (or the version before that), then it's not properly maintained and isn't worth using.
The newest one if possible. Sometimes not possible if you are forced to use a certain lightbox or something..
using anything less than current is fundamentally unwise. there have been serious performance improvements and major bug fixes, especially from 1.2.6.
I think that now it's goog time to update your jQuery libraries, because Chackra Engine of the Internet Explorer 9 sux and support for this browser was added in jQuery 1.5.1
Always the most recent stable version
1.3.2 in production, in the middle of upgrading to 1.5.2...
